alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 8:04PM CST until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Choctaw, Clarke and Washington Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 29.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Friday was 30.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 28.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to 29.7 feet Sunday evening. It will fall to 29.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then rise to 29.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
